ETYMOLOGY: From Old French statut, from Latin statūtum 'something established', neuter past participle of statuere 'to set up, establish'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A written law passed by a legislative body.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 由立法机关通过的成文法律。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new statute aims to protect consumer rights.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这项新法规旨在保护消费者权益。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A rule or regulation made by a company or society, which is intended to be permanent.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某公司或社团制定的旨在长期有效的规章或条例。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The club's statutes clearly define membership requirements.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 俱乐部的章程明确规定了会员资格要求。
